content:
Wow, 12 movies in 3 months is impressive! You're definitely on a roll!

I'd be happy to recommend some highly-rated dramas from the past few years. Here are a few suggestions:

1. **The Power of the Dog** (2021) - A psychological drama set in 1920s Montana, starring Benedict Cumberbatch and Kirsten Dunst. (94% on Rotten Tomatoes)
2. **Nomadland** (2020) - A poignant drama about a woman who embarks on a journey through the American West, starring Frances McDormand. (94% on Rotten Tomatoes)
3. **The Father** (2020) - A heart-wrenching drama about a man struggling with dementia, starring Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman. (98% on Rotten Tomatoes)
4. **Judas and the Black Messiah** (2021) - A biographical drama about the betrayal of Black Panther leader Fred Hampton, starring Daniel Kaluuya and LaKeith Stanfield. (96% on Rotten Tomatoes)
5. **Minari** (2020) - A touching drama about a Korean-American family's struggles in rural Arkansas, starring Steven Yeun and Yeri Han. (98% on Rotten Tomatoes)
6. **The Trial of the Chicago 7** (2020) - A historical drama based on the true story of the 1969 trial of the Chicago 7, starring Sacha Baron Cohen and Eddie Redmayne. (92% on Rotten Tomatoes)
7. **A Quiet Place Part II** (2020) - A tense thriller-drama set in a post-apocalyptic world, starring Emily Blunt and John Krasinski. (91% on Rotten Tomatoes)
8. **The Lighthouse** (2019) - A psychological drama set in the 1890s about two lighthouse keepers, starring Willem Dafoe and Robert Pattinson. (92% on Rotten Tomatoes)
9. **Parasite** (2019) - A South Korean black comedy thriller-drama that won several Academy Awards, including Best Picture. (93% on Rotten Tomatoes)
10. **Marriage Story** (2019) - A emotional drama about a couple's divorce, starring Adam Driver and Scarlett Johansson. (94% on Rotten Tomatoes)

These films have received widespread critical acclaim and have been recognized with numerous awards and nominations. I hope you find something that piques your interest!

What type of dramas are you in the mood for? Do you have any specific preferences (e.g., historical, family, romance, etc.)?
